channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Shutdown hits day 15 as public feels the strain and Capitol Hill standoff drags on
item.description: The government shutdown is on its 15th day, and as the public increasingly begins to feel the effects, it remains unclear which party on Capitol Hill will blink first.
item.content:encoded: The government shutdown is on its 15th day, and as the public increasingly begins to feel the effects, it remains unclear which party on Capitol Hill will blink first.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Republican Rep. Mike Lawler on his calls for Democrats to reopen the government
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Republican Congressman Mike Lawler of New York about the ongoing government shutdown and his calls for Democrats in his state to end it.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Republican Congressman Mike Lawler of New York about the ongoing government shutdown and his calls for Democrats in his state to end it.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: L.A. County Board of Supervisors declares ICE raids a local emergency
item.description: The Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors voted Tuesday to declare a local emergency in response to immigration enforcement actions in the area.
item.content:encoded: The Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors voted Tuesday to declare a local emergency in response to immigration enforcement actions in the area.
item.dc:creator: Destiny Torres

item.title: Supreme Court hears case that questions major plank of voting rights
item.description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday hears a case that could strike down the last major part of the 1965 Voting Rights Act that remains standing.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court on Wednesday hears a case that could strike down the last major part of the 1965 Voting Rights Act that remains standing.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Gaza ceasefire under strain amid threats from Israel and Trump, shutdown standoff drags on as public begins to feel the effects, Supreme Court to hear case that could gut Voting Rights Act.
item.content:encoded: Gaza ceasefire under strain amid threats from Israel and Trump, shutdown standoff drags on as public begins to feel the effects, Supreme Court to hear case that could gut Voting Rights Act.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Author of anti-fascism book harassed by right-wing activists for his work
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Mark Bray, a professor at Rutgers University who has been targeted by right-wing activists for his writings on anti-fascism.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Mark Bray, a professor at Rutgers University who has been targeted by right-wing activists for his writings on anti-fascism.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Military seizes power in Madagascar after massive anti-government protests
item.description: The military in Madagascar seized power Tuesday after weeks of protests over corruption, power and water shortages forced the country's president into hiding.
item.content:encoded: The military in Madagascar seized power Tuesday after weeks of protests over corruption, power and water shortages forced the country's president into hiding.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Remembering D'Angelo: Soulful visionary and pioneer of the neo soul movement
item.description: D'Angelo, the Grammy-winning R&B singer who helped pioneer the neo soul sub genre, died Tuesday at age 51. NPR's Leila Fadel talks with Faith Pennick, who wrote a book about his album "Voodoo."
item.content:encoded: D'Angelo, the Grammy-winning R&B singer who helped pioneer the neo soul sub genre, died Tuesday at age 51. NPR's Leila Fadel talks with Faith Pennick, who wrote a book about his album "Voodoo."
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Storm devastates Western Alaska, displacing over 1,000 people
item.description: The remnants of Typhoon Halong hit part of western Alaska over the weekend, damaging almost 50 small villages and displacing over 1,000 people.
item.content:encoded: The remnants of Typhoon Halong hit part of western Alaska over the weekend, damaging almost 50 small villages and displacing over 1,000 people.
item.dc:creator: Sage Smiley

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Trump issue warnings to Hamas
item.description: Just six days in, the Gaza ceasefire faces some strain as Israel demands Hamas hand over more bodies of hostages and Trump warns of violence if Hamas doesn't disarm itself.
item.content:encoded: Just six days in, the Gaza ceasefire faces some strain as Israel demands Hamas hand over more bodies of hostages and Trump warns of violence if Hamas doesn't disarm itself.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
